Name: Mail delegation SHALL be disabled for all users by default.
DKIM SHOULD be enabled for agencies’ mail enabled domain.
Last Successful Test: Cannot create rule due to no log event generated

Name: Agencies SHALL determine which IP addresses are approved senders for their domain(s).
Agencies SHALL publish SPF policy(s) that designate these (and only these) addresses as approved senders for their domain(s).
Agencies SHALL publish a DMARC policy.
Agencies SHALL set their policy to message rejection (i.e., “p=reject”).
Agencies SHALL include reports@dmarc.cyber.dhs.gov as a point of contact for aggregate reports.
Agencies SHOULD include an agency point of contact for aggregate and/or failure reports in their policy.
Protect against encrypted attachments from untrusted senders SHALL be enabled.
Setting Name (Is): Attachment safety Enable: protect against encrypted attachments from untrusted senders

Name: Protect against attachments with scripts from untrusted senders SHALL be enabled.
Setting Name (Is): Attachment safety Enable: protect against attachments with scripts from untrusted senders

Name: Protect against anomalous attachment types in emails SHALL be enabled.
Setting Name (Is): Attachment safety Enable: Protect against anomalous attachment types in emails

Name: Google SHOULD be allowed to automatically apply future recommended settings.
Setting Name (Is): Attachment safety Enable: automatically enables all future added settings

Name: At the least, email SHOULD be kept in the inbox and show warning labels for attachment protection controls.

Setting Name (Is): Attachment safety Anomalous attachment protection setting action

Name: Any third-party or outside application selected for attachment protection SHOULD offer services comparable to those offered by Google Workspace.
Identify links behind shortened URLs SHALL be Enabled.
Setting Name (Is): Links and external images safety Enable: identify links behind shortened URLs

Name: Scan linked images SHALL be enabled.
Setting Name (Is): Links and external images safety Enable: scan linked images

Name: Show warning prompt for any click on links to untrusted domains SHALL be enabled.
Setting Name (Is): Links and external images safety Enable: show warning prompt for click on links to unstrusted domains

Name: Google SHALL be allowed to automatically apply future recommended settings.
Setting Name (Is): Links and external images safety Enable: automatically enables all future added settings

Name: Any third-party or outside application selected for links and external images protection SHOULD offer services comparable to those offered by Google Workspace.
Protect against domain spoofing based on similar domain names SHALL be enabled.
Setting Name (Is): Spoofing and authentication safety Enable: protect against domain spoofing using similar domain names

Name: Protect against spoofing of employee names SHALL be enabled.
Setting Name (Is): Spoofing and authentication safety Enable: protect against spoofing of employee names

Name: Protect against inbound emails spoofing your domain SHALL be enabled.
Setting Name (Is): Spoofing and authentication safety Enable: protect against inbound emails spoofing your domain

Setting Name (Is): Spoofing and authentication safety Enable: protect against any unauthenticated emails

Name: Google SHALL be allowed to automatically apply future recommended settings.

Name: Any third-party or outside application selected for spoofing and authentication protection SHOULD offer services comparable to those offered by Google Workspace.
User email uploads SHALL be disabled to protect against unauthorized files being introduced into the secured environment.
POP and IMAP access SHALL be disabled to protect sensitive agency or organization emails from being accessed through legacy applications or other third-party mail clients.
POP and IMAP access SHALL be disabled to protect sensitive agency or organization emails from being accessed through legacy applications or other third-party mail clients.
POP and IMAP access MAY be enabled on a per-user and per-application basis as needed.
Google Workspace Sync SHOULD be disabled.
Google Workspace Sync MAY be enabled on a per-user basis as needed.
Automatic forwarding SHOULD be disabled, especially to external domains.
Using a per-user outbound gateway that is a mail server other than the Google Workspace mail servers SHALL be disabled.
Unintended external reply warnings SHALL be enabled to avoid unintentional replies and remind users to treat external messages with caution.
An email allowlist SHOULD not be implemented.
Enhanced pre-delivery message scanning SHALL be enabled to prevent phishing.
Any third-party or outside application selected for enhanced pre-delivery message scanning SHOULD offer services comparable to those offered by Google Workspace.
Security sandbox SHOULD be enabled to provide additional protections for their email messages.
Any third-party or outside application selected for security sandbox SHOULD offer services comparable to those offered by Google Workspace.
Comprehensive mail storage SHOULD be enabled to ensure information can be tracked across applications.
Content filtering SHOULD be enabled within Gmail messages.
Any third-party or outside application selected for advanced email content filtering SHOULD offer services comparable to those offered by Google Workspace.

Gmail or third-party applications SHALL be configured to protect PII and sensitive information as defined by the agency. At a minimum, credit card numbers, taxpayer Identification Numbers (TIN), and Social Security Numbers (SSN) SHALL be blocked.
Domains SHALL NOT be added to lists that bypass spam filters.
Domains SHALL NOT be added to lists that bypass spam filters and hide warnings.
Bypass spam filters and hide warnings for all messages from internal and external senders SHALL NOT be enabled.
